12  // Output stream operator is used by dump() in TabularSatStore
13  ostream& operator<<(ostream& os, const ClockRecord& rec) throw()
14  {
15  os << scientific << setprecision(12) << setw(19) << rec.bias
16  << " " << setw(19) << rec.sig_bias
17  << " " << setw(19) << rec.drift
18  << " " << setw(19) << rec.sig_drift
19  //<< " " << setw(19) << rec.accel
20  //<< " " << setw(19) << rec.sig_accel
21  ;
22  return os;
23  }

25  // Return value for the given satellite at the given time (usually via
26  // interpolation of the data table). This interface from TabularSatStore.
27  // @param[in] sat the SatID of the satellite of interest
28  // @param[in] ttag the time (CommonTime) of interest
29  // @return object of type ClockRecord containing the data value(s).
30  // @throw InvalidRequest if data value cannot be computed, for example because
31  // a) the time t does not lie within the time limits of the data table
32  // b) checkDataGap is true and there is a data gap
33  // c) checkInterval is true and the interval is larger than maxInterval
34  ClockRecord ClockSatStore::getValue(const SatID& sat, const CommonTime& ttag)
35  const throw(InvalidRequest)
36  {
37  try {
38  checkTimeSystem(ttag.getTimeSystem());
39 
40  bool isExact;
41  ClockRecord rec;
42  DataTableIterator it1, it2, kt; // cf. TabularSatStore.hpp
43 
44  isExact = getTableInterval(sat, ttag, Nhalf, it1, it2, haveClockDrift);
45  if(isExact && haveClockDrift) {
46  rec = it1->second;
47  return rec;
48  }
49 
50  // pull data out of the data table
51  int n,Nlow(Nhalf-1),Nhi(Nhalf),Nmatch(Nhalf);
52  CommonTime ttag0(it1->first);
53  vector<double> times,biases,drifts,accels,sig_biases,sig_drifts,sig_accels;
54 
55  kt=it1; n=0;
56  while(1) {
57  // find index of matching time tag
58  if(isExact && ABS(kt->first-ttag) < 1.e-8) Nmatch = n;
59  times.push_back(kt->first - ttag0); // sec
60  biases.push_back(kt->second.bias); // sec
61  drifts.push_back(kt->second.drift); // sec/sec
62  accels.push_back(kt->second.accel); // sec/sec^2
63  sig_biases.push_back(kt->second.sig_bias); // sec
64  sig_drifts.push_back(kt->second.sig_drift); // sec/sec
65  sig_accels.push_back(kt->second.sig_accel); // sec/sec^2
66  if(kt == it2) break;
67  ++kt;
68  ++n;
69  };
70 
71  if(isExact && Nmatch==Nhalf-1) { Nlow++; Nhi++; }
72 
73  // interpolate
74  rec.accel = rec.sig_accel = 0.0; // defaults
75  double dt(ttag-ttag0), err, slope;
76  if(haveClockDrift) {
77  if(interpType == 2) {
78  // Lagrange interpolation
79  rec.bias = LagrangeInterpolation(times,biases,dt,err); // sec
80  rec.drift = LagrangeInterpolation(times,drifts,dt,err); // sec/sec
81  }
82  else {
83  // linear interpolation
84  slope = (biases[Nhi]-biases[Nlow]) /
85  (times[Nhi]-times[Nlow]); // sec/sec
86  rec.bias = biases[Nlow] + slope*(dt-times[Nlow]); // sec
87  slope = (drifts[Nhi]-drifts[Nlow])/(times[Nhi]-times[Nlow]);
88  rec.drift = drifts[Nlow] + slope*(dt-times[Nlow]); // sec/sec
89  }
90 
91  // sigmas
92  if(isExact)
93  rec.sig_bias = sig_biases[Nmatch];
94  else
95  rec.sig_bias = RSS(sig_biases[Nhi],sig_biases[Nlow]);
96  rec.sig_drift = RSS(sig_drifts[Nhi],sig_drifts[Nlow]);
97  }
98  else { // must interpolate biases to get drift
99  if(interpType == 2) {
100  // Lagrange interpolation
101  LagrangeInterpolation(times,biases,dt,rec.bias,rec.drift);
102  }
103  else {
104  // linear interpolation
105  rec.drift = (biases[Nhi]-biases[Nlow]) /
106  (times[Nhi]-times[Nlow]); // sec/sec^2
107  rec.bias = biases[Nlow] + (dt-times[Nlow])*rec.drift; // sec/sec
108  }
109 
110  // sigmas
111  if(isExact)
112  rec.sig_bias = sig_biases[Nmatch];
113  else
114  rec.sig_bias = RSS(sig_biases[Nhi],sig_biases[Nlow]);
115  // TD ?
116  rec.sig_drift = rec.sig_bias/(times[Nhi]-times[Nlow]);
117  }
118 
119  if(haveClockAccel) {
120  if(interpType == 2) {
121  // Lagrange interpolation
122  rec.accel = LagrangeInterpolation(times,accels,dt,err); // sec/sec^2
123  }
124  else {
125  // linear interpolation
126  slope = (drifts[Nhi]-drifts[Nlow]) /
127  (times[Nhi]-times[Nlow]); // sec/sec^2
128  rec.accel = accels[Nlow] + slope*(dt-times[Nlow]); // sec/sec^2
129  }
130 
131  // sigma
132  if(isExact)
133  rec.sig_accel = sig_accels[Nmatch];
134  else
135  rec.sig_accel = RSS(sig_accels[Nhi],sig_accels[Nlow]);
136  }
137  else if(haveClockDrift) { // must interpolate drift to get accel
138  if(interpType == 2) {
139  // Lagrange interpolation (err is a dummy here)
140  LagrangeInterpolation(times,drifts,dt,err,rec.accel);
141  }
142  else {
143  // linear interpolation // sec/sec^2
144  rec.accel = (drifts[Nhi]-drifts[Nlow]) / (times[Nhi]-times[Nlow]);
145  }
146 
147  // sigmas TD is there a better way?
148  rec.sig_accel = rec.sig_drift/(times[Nhi]-times[Nlow]);
149  }
150  // else zero
151 
152  return rec;
153  }
154  catch(InvalidRequest& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
155  }
156 
157  // Return the clock bias for the given satellite at the given time
158  // @param[in] sat the SatID of the satellite of interest
159  // @param[in] ttag the time (CommonTime) of interest
160  // @return double the clock bias
161  // @throw InvalidRequest if bias cannot be computed, for example because
162  // a) the time t does not lie within the time limits of the data table
163  // b) checkDataGap is true and there is a data gap
164  // c) checkInterval is true and the interval is larger than maxInterval
165  double ClockSatStore::getClockBias(const SatID& sat, const CommonTime& ttag)
166  const throw(InvalidRequest)
167  {
168  try {
169  checkTimeSystem(ttag.getTimeSystem());
170 
171  DataTableIterator it1, it2, kt;
172  if(getTableInterval(sat, ttag, Nhalf, it1, it2, true)) {
173  // exact match
174  ClockRecord rec;
175  rec = it1->second;
176  return rec.bias;
177  }
178 
179  // pull data out of the data table
180  vector<double> times,biases;
181  CommonTime ttag0(it1->first);
182  kt = it1;
183  while(1) {
184  times.push_back(kt->first - ttag0); // sec
185  biases.push_back(kt->second.bias); // sec
186  if(kt == it2) break;
187  ++kt;
188  };
189 
190  // interpolate
191  double bias, dt(ttag-ttag0), err, slope;
192  if(interpType == 2) { // Lagrange interpolation
193  bias = LagrangeInterpolation(times,biases,dt,err); // sec
194  }
195  else { // linear interpolation
196  slope = (biases[Nhalf]-biases[Nhalf-1])/(times[Nhalf]-times[Nhalf-1]);
197  bias = biases[Nhalf-1] + slope*(dt-times[Nhalf-1]); // sec
198  }
199 
200  return bias;
201  }
202  catch(InvalidRequest& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
203  }
204 
205  // Return the clock drift for the given satellite at the given time
206  // @param[in] sat the SatID of the satellite of interest
207  // @param[in] ttag the time (CommonTime) of interest
208  // @return double the clock drift
209  // @throw InvalidRequest if drift cannot be computed, for example because
210  // a) the time t does not lie within the time limits of the data table
211  // b) checkDataGap is true and there is a data gap
212  // c) checkInterval is true and the interval is larger than maxInterval
213  // d) there is no drift data in the store
214  double ClockSatStore::getClockDrift(const SatID& sat, const CommonTime& ttag)
215  const throw(InvalidRequest)
216  {
217  try {
218  checkTimeSystem(ttag.getTimeSystem());
219 
220  DataTableIterator it1, it2, kt;
221  bool isExact(getTableInterval(sat, ttag, Nhalf, it1, it2, haveClockDrift));
222  if(isExact && haveClockDrift) {
223  ClockRecord rec;
224  rec = it1->second;
225  return rec.drift;
226  }
227 
228  // pull data out of the data table
229  int n,Nhi(Nhalf);
230  CommonTime ttag0(it1->first);
231  vector<double> times,biases,drifts;
232 
233  n = 0;
234  kt = it1;
235  while(1) {
236  if(isExact && ABS(kt->first-ttag) < 1.e-8) Nhi=n;
237  times.push_back(kt->first - ttag0); // sec
238  if(haveClockDrift)
239  drifts.push_back(kt->second.bias); // sec/sec
240  else
241  biases.push_back(kt->second.bias); // sec
242  if(kt == it2) break;
243  ++kt;
244  ++n;
245  };
246 
247  if(isExact && Nhi==Nhalf-1) Nhi++;
248 
249  // interpolate
250  double drift, dt(ttag-ttag0), err, slope;
251  if(haveClockDrift) {
252  if(interpType == 2) {
253  // Lagrange interpolation
254  drift = LagrangeInterpolation(times,drifts,dt,err); // sec/sec
255  }
256  else {
257  // linear interpolation
258  slope = (drifts[Nhi]-drifts[Nhi-1]) / (times[Nhi]-times[Nhi-1]);
259  drift = drifts[Nhi-1] + slope*(dt-times[Nhi-1]); // sec/sec
260  }
261  }
262  else {
263  if(interpType == 2) {
264  // Lagrange interpolation // slope is dummy
265  LagrangeInterpolation(times,biases,dt,slope,drift);
266  }
267  else {
268  // linear interpolation
269  drift = (biases[Nhi]-biases[Nhi-1])/(times[Nhi]-times[Nhi-1]);//sec/sec
270  }
271  }
272 
273  return drift;
274  }
275  catch(InvalidRequest& e) { GPSTK_RETHROW(e); }
276  }
277 
278  // Add a ClockRecord to the store.
279  void ClockSatStore::addClockRecord(const SatID& sat, const CommonTime& ttag,
280  const ClockRecord& rec)
281  throw(InvalidRequest)
282  {
283  try {
284  checkTimeSystem(ttag.getTimeSystem());
285 
286  if(rec.drift != 0.0) haveClockDrift = true;
287  if(rec.accel != 0.0) haveClockAccel = true;
288 
289  if(tables.find(sat) != tables.end() &&
290  tables[sat].find(ttag) != tables[sat].end()) {
291  // record already exists in the table
292  ClockRecord& oldrec(tables[sat][ttag]);
293  oldrec.bias = rec.bias;
294  oldrec.sig_bias = rec.sig_bias;
295  if(haveClockDrift) {
296  oldrec.drift = rec.drift;
297  oldrec.sig_drift = rec.sig_drift;
298  }
299  if(haveClockAccel) {
300  oldrec.accel = rec.accel;
301  oldrec.sig_accel = rec.sig_accel;
302  }
303  }
304  else // create a new entry in the table
305  tables[sat][ttag] = rec;
306  }
307  catch(InvalidRequest& ir) { GPSTK_RETHROW(ir); }
308  }
309 
310  // Add clock bias (only) data to the store
311  void ClockSatStore::addClockBias(const SatID& sat, const CommonTime& ttag,
312  const double& bias, const double& sig)
313  throw(InvalidRequest)
314  {
315  try {
316  checkTimeSystem(ttag.getTimeSystem());
317 
318  if(tables.find(sat) != tables.end() &&
319  tables[sat].find(ttag) != tables[sat].end()) {
320  // record already exists in the table
321  ClockRecord& oldrec(tables[sat][ttag]);
322  oldrec.bias = bias;
323  oldrec.sig_bias = sig;
324  }
325  else { // create a new entry in the table
326  ClockRecord rec;
327  rec.bias = bias;
328  rec.sig_bias = sig;
329  rec.drift = rec.sig_drift = 0.0;
330  rec.accel = rec.sig_accel = 0.0;
331 
332  tables[sat][ttag] = rec;
333  }
334  }
335  catch(InvalidRequest& ir) { GPSTK_RETHROW(ir); }
336  }
337 
338  // Add clock drift (only) data to the store
339  void ClockSatStore::addClockDrift(const SatID& sat, const CommonTime& ttag,
340  const double& drift, const double& sig)
341  throw(InvalidRequest)
342  {
343  try {
344  checkTimeSystem(ttag.getTimeSystem());
345 
346  haveClockDrift = true;
347 
348  if(tables.find(sat) != tables.end() &&
349  tables[sat].find(ttag) != tables[sat].end()) {
350  // record already exists in the table
351  ClockRecord& oldrec(tables[sat][ttag]);
352  oldrec.drift = drift;
353  oldrec.sig_drift = sig;
354  }
355  else { // create a new entry in the table
356  ClockRecord rec;
357  rec.drift = drift;
358  rec.sig_drift = sig;
359  rec.bias = rec.sig_bias = 0.0;
360  rec.accel = rec.sig_accel = 0.0;
361 
362  tables[sat][ttag] = rec;
363  }
364  }
365  catch(InvalidRequest& ir) { GPSTK_RETHROW(ir); }
366  }
367 
368  // Add clock acceleration (only) data to the store
369  void ClockSatStore::addClockAcceleration(const SatID& sat, const CommonTime& ttag,
370  const double& accel, const double& sig)
371  throw(InvalidRequest)
372  {
373  try {
374  checkTimeSystem(ttag.getTimeSystem());
375 
376  haveClockAccel = true;
377 
378  if(tables.find(sat) != tables.end() &&
379  tables[sat].find(ttag) != tables[sat].end()) {
380  // record already exists in the table
381  ClockRecord& oldrec(tables[sat][ttag]);
382  oldrec.accel = accel;
383  oldrec.sig_accel = sig;
384  }
385  else { // create a new entry in the table
386  ClockRecord rec;
387  rec.accel = accel;
388  rec.sig_accel = sig;
389  rec.drift = rec.sig_drift = 0.0;
390  rec.bias = rec.sig_bias = 0.0;
391 
392  tables[sat][ttag] = rec;
393  }
394  }
395  catch(InvalidRequest& ir) { GPSTK_RETHROW(ir); }
396  }
